items.content: Hi! My name's Jim. I'm from New Zealand. This is my friend. His name's Adam. He's from Australia. This is my friend too. Her name's Paola. She's from Italy. This is another friend. His name's Brian. He's from Canada. This is another friend. Her name's Karima. She's from Egypt. This is another friend. His name's Denis. He's from Ukraine. This is my friend Kostas. He's from Greece. This is my friend Hayley. She's from Australia too. This is my friend Gabriela. She's from Argentina. What's your name? Where are you from?

descriptionTranslation.translation: Текст для изучения названий стран и знакомства с употреблением глагола "to be" в простом настоящем времени, в его утвердительной форме.

items.title: Names and countries

items.content: Karima isn't Pole, she's from Egypt, she's Egyptian. Marco isn't American, he's from Italy, he's Italian. Pavel and Adam aren't Greek, they're from Poland, they're Pole. Hayley isn't British, she's from Australia, she's Australian. Brian isn't Chinese, he's from Canada, he's Canadian. I'm Kelly, I'm not Spanish, I'm from the United States, I'm American. Gabriela isn't Russian, she's from Argentina, she's Argentinean. Satomi isn't Italian, she's from Japan, she's Japanese. Samuel and me aren't Argentinean, we're from Great Britain, we're British. You aren't Egyptian, you're from China, you're Chinese.

descriptionTranslation.translation: В этом тексте приводятся названия стран и национальностей на английском, также этот текст дает возможность ознакомиться с употреблением глагола "to be" с местоимениями в единственном и множественном числе в его утвердительной и отрицательной формах.

items.title: Countries and Nationalities

items.content:
Kelly: What's in your bag?
Adam: a pen, an apple, a pencil, a book, an iPod, a mobile, an umbrella, a credit card, a key, glasses, an ID card, a camera, a sandwich and a dictionary. And what's in your bag?
Kelly: 4 pens, 8 apples, 3 pencils, 2 books, an iPod too, a mobile, 2 umbrellas, 7 credit cards, 10 keys, glasses, an ID card, 3 cameras, 4 sandwiches, and 2 dictionaries.

descriptionTranslation.translation: Этот текст знакомит с названиями некоторых мелких повседневных предметов, дает представление об использовании артикля с существительными в единственом числе, а также знакомит с образованием множественного числа существительных в английском языке.

items.title: Things in my bag

items.content: This is a camera, cameras are from the United States. This is an umbrella, umbrellas are from Italy. This is an iPod, iPods are from Korea. This is an apple, apples are from Poland. This is a photo, photos are from Argentina. This is a book, books are from Greece. This is a bag, bags are from Ukraine. This is a car, cars are from France. This is a mobile, mobiles are from China. This is a pen, pens are from Canada. This is a dictionary, dictionaries are from Spain. This is a sandwich, sandwiches are from Sweden.

descriptionTranslation.translation: Этот текст знакомит с названиями мелких повседневных предметов, также с названиями стран на английском, дает представление о формировании множественного числа существительных и о правилах употребления глагола "to be" с единственным и множественным числом существительных.

items.title: Umbrella from Italy

items.content: Hi, I'm Laura from Dublin, Ireland. I'm nineteen. I'm a student. I'm not married. Look at the photo. This is Carla and her friend Kevin. They're my friends. They aren't from Italy, they're from Germany, from Berlin. Carla is twenty-six. She's a manager. She isn't married, she's single. Kevin is thirty. He's a taxi driver. He isn't single, he's married. And this is my friend Adi from Israel. He's forty-nine. He's a businessman. He's married. Are you from Canada? How old are you? Are you a nurse?

descriptionTranslation.translation: Этот текст знакомит с названиями стран, профессий и числительными,  дает представление о том, как передать личную информацию о себе и других, знакомясь с людьми,  также текст дает понимание того, как употреблять глагол "to be" в утвердительной и отрицательной формах.

items.title: Laura, a student from Dublin

items.content: This is Molly from the USA. She isn't a shop assistant, she's a teacher. She's fantastic. This is John and his friend Dan from Great Britain. They aren't actors, they are builders. This is Ondar from Turkey. He isn't a student, he's a businessman. He's good-looking. This is Enrique from Italy. He's not a police officer, he's a taxi driver. He's tired. This is Pablo from Argentina and his friend Nina from Brazil. They aren't builders, they're doctors. They're nice. This is Loku from South Africa. He isn't a teacher, he's a lawyer. This is Yong from China. He isn't a student, he's a manager. This is Jenifer from the USA. She isn't a lawyer, she's an actress. She's fantastic and good-looking. This is Daril from Sweden, he isn't a taxi driver, he's a shop assistant. He's tired. Is this your friend? Where's he from? What's his name? Is he a lawyer? Is he nice?

descriptionTranslation.translation: Этот текст знакомит с названиями стран, профессиями и некоторыми прилагательными, показаны случаи употребления неопределенного артикля с названиями профессий, также приведены примеры употребления глагола "to be" в утвердительной, отрицательной и вопросительной формах.

items.title: Countries and jobs

items.content:
First name: Adrian.
Surname: Martinez.
Country: Australia.
Town/city: Sydney.
Age: 32.
Address: 254 Crown str.
Phone number: 6 5 2 - 9 4 - 3 7.
Email address: adr.Martinez@gmail.com.
Job: lawyer.
Married: No.

descriptionTranslation.translation: В этом тексте приводится пример заполнения анкеты с личной информацией.

items.title: Facebook profile

items.content: This is our neighbour Grace Taylor and her big family. Grace is retired. She has a son and a daughter. Her daughter's name is Anne, she's married. Her husband's name is Jim. He's a lawyer. They have two children, a son Kevin and a daughter Nicola. Their children are students. Kevin's sister is twelve and Nicola's brother is fifteen. Anne is a good wife, a mother and a sister. Anne's brother isn't married, but he has a girlfriend Nina. He's a taxi driver and his girlfriend is a shop assistant. Nina is nice. Her father is a taxi driver too. Nina and I are friends. Our fathers are friends too. We have a neighbour. Our neighbour is Grace. She's a good grandmother and a good neighbour.

descriptionTranslation.translation: В этом тексте описана семья, упоминаются професии членов семьи и приводятся прилагательные, которые описывают качества человека. Также приведены примеры  употребления притяжательного падежа существительных, который указывает на принадлежность существительного тому или иному лицу.

items.title: Our neighbour and her family

items.content:
This is our mother, she's nice and beautiful. She has two sisters and a brother. Her brother is old and funny. Her sisters are friendly. This is our father. He's great. This is my husband. He's great too. We have two daughters. They are friendly and beautiful. We have a dog, it's old, but it isn't bad. 
We have an unfriendly neighbour, he's ugly. 
Our children have a new camera, it's expensive. They have two iPods too, they aren't cheap. This is our cat, it's small and funny. This is our photo. We are a beautiful and happy family. This is my old mobile, it's bad and ugly. My new mobile is good and nice.
We are in a café now. It's small and cold, but nice. People are friendly and funny here. We have hot sandwiches, they aren't expensive. My husband has tea, it's cheap. I have coffee, it's expensive and bad. His tea is hot and my coffee is cold. It's funny. They have books here in the café. The books are big and small, new and old, cheap and expensive.

descriptionTranslation.translation: Основной акцент в тексте сделан на новых прилагательных, которые описывают качества и свойства человека или предмета. Текст также дает возможность освежить в памяти названия членов семьи, мелких повседневных предметов и притяжательные местоимения, напоминает правила употребления глаголов "to have", "to be".

items.title: An old mobile, a funny cat

items.content: We have stereotypes about people and food. Americans like Coke and hamburgers. Chinese eat a lot of rice and drink green tea. Italians eat only pizza and pasta. Germans drink a lot of beer and love sausages. French drink a lot of wine and love cheese. Ukrainians eat a lot of potatoes and like meat. English drink tea with milk. Japanese eat a lot of fish. Women love chocolate. Men love beer. Children love ice-cream. Vegetarians eat only vegetables and fruit. Europeans and Americans drink a lot of coffee.

descriptionTranslation.translation: В этом тексте описываются некоторые стереотипы о разных народах и их пристрастиях в еде, тем самым знакомя читателя с названиями блюд и продуктов на английском. Текст также знакомит с некоторыми глаголами по теме "Еда/напитки" и правилами их употребления в настоящем простом времени.

items.title: Stereotypes about food and nationalities
